content: generate and show me an cartoon egg that is sad

tool_args.prompt: Cute cartoon sad egg, simple flat vector style. Egg character with smooth white shell, large expressive teary eyes (shiny highlights), a single tear rolling down the cheek, a small downturned mouth, subtle pink blush on cheeks, tiny stick arms and legs, slightly hunched posture to emphasize sadness. Soft pastel blue background with a gentle vignette, soft drop shadow beneath egg. Clean outlines, high contrast, bright but muted colors, 1024x1024 composition centered on the character. Friendly, non-creepy, suitable for stickers and avatars.
tool_args.reason: User requested a generated cartoon image of a sad egg.

reason: User requested a generated cartoon image of a sad egg.

tool_result.error: flux2 failed: Error: api error (403): User is locked. Reason: Exhausted balance. Top up your balance at fal.ai/dashboard/billing.

tool_args.reason: Check memory for existing images or art guidelines before generating SVG for user

reason: Check memory for existing images or art guidelines before generating SVG for user

content:
Sorry — the image generator failed (flux2 returned a 403: user locked / exhausted balance). I can’t use that tool right now. I made a ready-to-save SVG of a cute sad egg you can open in your browser or convert to PNG.

Save the text below to a file named sad-egg.svg and open it in your browser:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="1024" height="1024" viewBox="0 0 1024 1024">
  <!-- background -->
  <defs>
    <radialGradient id="bgGrad" cx="50%" cy="35%" r="70%">
      <stop offset="0%" stop-color="#d8eefc"/>
      <stop offset="100%" stop-color="#cfe8fb"/>
    </radialGradient>
    <linearGradient id="tearGrad" x1="0" x2="0" y1="0" y2="1">
      <stop offset="0%" stop-color="#9be0ff"/>
      <stop offset="100%" stop-color="#4fb3ff"/>
    </linearGradient>
    <filter id="softShadow" x="-50%" y="-50%" width="200%" height="200%">
      <feGaussianBlur stdDeviation="18" result="b"/>
      <feOffset dx="0" dy="18" result="c"/>
      <feMerge>
        <feMergeNode in="c"/>
        <feMergeNode in="SourceGraphic"/>
      </feMerge>
    </filter>
  </defs>

  <rect width="100%" height="100%" fill="url(#bgGrad)"/>

  <!-- subtle vignette -->
  <ellipse cx="512" cy="420" rx="420" ry="320" fill="rgba(0,0,0,0.04)"/>

  <!-- shadow -->
  <ellipse cx="512" cy="770" rx="220" ry="38" fill="rgba(0,0,0,0.18)"/>

  <!-- egg body -->
  <g filter="">
    <path d="M512 160
             C660 160 820 300 820 490
             C820 700 660 860 512 860
             C364 860 204 700 204 490
             C204 300 364 160 512 160 Z"
          fill="#ffffff" stroke="#f0f5f8" stroke-width="6" />
    <!-- subtle inner shadow -->
    <path d="M512 160
             C660 160 820 300 820 490
             C820 700 660 860 512 860
             C364 860 204 700 204 490
             C204 300 364 160 512 160 Z"
          fill="none" stroke="rgba(0,0,0,0.03)" stroke-width="30" stroke-linejoin="round" opacity="0.6"/>
  </g>

  <!-- blush -->
  <ellipse cx="420" cy="530" rx="34" ry="20" fill="#ffd6de" opacity="0.9"/>
  <ellipse cx="604" cy="530" rx="34" ry="20" fill="#ffd6de" opacity="0.9"/>

  <!-- eyes -->
  <g fill="#1c1c1c">
    <ellipse cx="440" cy="460" rx="38" ry="48"/>
    <ellipse cx="584" cy="460" rx="38" ry="48"/>
  </g>
  <!-- eye highlights -->
  <g fill="#ffffff">
    <circle cx="452" cy="440" r="12"/>
    <circle cx="596" cy="440" r="12"/>
    <circle cx="444" cy="476" r="6" opacity="0.5"/>
    <circle cx="588" cy="476" r="6" opacity="0.5"/>
  </g>

  <!-- tear -->
  <path d="M584 520
           C602 540 606 568 588 592
           C572 612 548 616 532 600
           C520 588 532 556 548 540
           C564 524 578 512 584 520 Z"
        fill="url(#tearGrad)" opacity="0.95" transform="translate(24,6) scale(0.9)"/>

  <!-- mouth (small downturned) -->
  <path d="M476 620 C512 648 560 648 588 620" fill="none" stroke="#5b2f33" stroke-width="10" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round" transform="translate(-6,-6)"/>

  <!-- tiny stick arms -->
  <path d="M328 610 L270 560" stroke="#c9c9c9" stroke-width="10" stroke-linecap="round"/>
  <path d="M696 610 L754 560" stroke="#c9c9c9" stroke-width="10" stroke-linecap="round"/>

  <!-- tiny stick legs -->
  <path d="M460 860 L430 920" stroke="#c9c9c9" stroke-width="12" stroke-linecap="round"/>
  <path d="M564 860 L594 920" stroke="#c9c9c9" stroke-width="12" stroke-linecap="round"/>

  <!-- subtle outline to separate from background -->
  <path d="M512 160
           C660 160 820 300 820 490
           C820 700 660 860 512 860
           C364 860 204 700 204 490
           C204 300 364 160 512 160 Z"
        fill="none" stroke="#e6eef2" stroke-width="4" opacity="0.9"/>

</svg>

If you want, I can:
- Convert this SVG to a PNG and send it (I can retry if image generation is available).
- Produce a slightly different expression (more tears, bigger eyes) and give you the SVG.
- Give a ready-to-run prompt for Stable Diffusion / DALL·E / Midjourney with model/settings.

Which would you prefer?
